{"step_by_step_thinking": "HOX genes are a group of related genes that control the body plan of an embryo along the head-tail axis. They play a crucial role in the development of limbs and organs. Polysyndactyly, a condition characterized by the presence of more than the usual number of digits, is a type of malformation that can be caused by mutations in HOX genes. Holoprosencephaly is a disorder caused by the failure of the prosencephalon to develop, which is not directly related to HOX genes. Mayer Rokitansky syndrome is a disorder that affects the reproductive system in females, and it's not related to HOX genes. Gorlin syndrome is a genetic condition that affects many areas of the body and is not caused by mutations in HOX genes.", "answer_choice": "A"}
